trans-unit.source: What is the Table Service
trans-unit.target: What is the Table Service

trans-unit.source: The Azure Table storage service stores large amounts of
trans-unit.target: The Azure Table storage service stores large amounts of

trans-unit.source: structured data.
trans-unit.target: structured data.

trans-unit.source: The service is a NoSQL datastore which accepts
trans-unit.target: The service is a NoSQL datastore which accepts

trans-unit.source: authenticated calls from inside and outside the Azure cloud.
trans-unit.target: authenticated calls from inside and outside the Azure cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: tables are ideal for storing structured, non-relational data.
trans-unit.target: tables are ideal for storing structured, non-relational data.

trans-unit.source: Common
trans-unit.target: Common

trans-unit.source: uses of the Table service include:
trans-unit.target: uses of the Table service include:

trans-unit.source: Storing TBs of structured data capable of serving web scale
trans-unit.target: Storing TBs of structured data capable of serving web scale

trans-unit.source: applications
trans-unit.target: applications

trans-unit.source: Storing datasets that don't require complex joins, foreign keys, or
trans-unit.target: Storing datasets that don't require complex joins, foreign keys, or

trans-unit.source: stored procedures and can be denormalized for fast access
trans-unit.target: stored procedures and can be denormalized for fast access

trans-unit.source: Quickly querying data using a clustered index
trans-unit.target: Quickly querying data using a clustered index

trans-unit.source: Accessing data using the OData protocol and LINQ queries with WCF
trans-unit.target: Accessing data using the OData protocol and LINQ queries with WCF

trans-unit.source: Data Service .NET Libraries
trans-unit.target: Data Service .NET Libraries

trans-unit.source: You can use the Table service to store and query huge sets of
trans-unit.target: You can use the Table service to store and query huge sets of

trans-unit.source: structured, non-relational data, and your tables will scale as demand
trans-unit.target: structured, non-relational data, and your tables will scale as demand

trans-unit.source: increases.
trans-unit.target: increases.

trans-unit.source: Table Service Concepts
trans-unit.target: Table Service Concepts

trans-unit.source: The Table service contains the following components:
trans-unit.target: The Table service contains the following components:

trans-unit.source: Table1
trans-unit.target: Table1

trans-unit.source: **URL format:** Code addresses tables in an account using this
trans-unit.target: **URL format:** Code addresses tables in an account using this

trans-unit.source: address format:
trans-unit.target: address format:

trans-unit.source: http://`<storage account>`.table.core.windows.net/`<table>`
trans-unit.target: http://`<storage account>`.table.core.windows.net/`<table>`

trans-unit.source: You can address Azure tables directly using this address with the
trans-unit.target: You can address Azure tables directly using this address with the

trans-unit.source: OData protocol.
trans-unit.target: OData protocol.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [OData.org][]
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [OData.org][]

trans-unit.source: **Storage Account:** All access to Azure Storage is done
trans-unit.target: **Storage Account:** All access to Azure Storage is done

trans-unit.source: through a storage account.
trans-unit.target: through a storage account.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets](storage-scalability-targets.md) for details about storage account capacity.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets](storage-scalability-targets.md) for details about storage account capacity.

trans-unit.source: **Table**: A table is a collection of entities.
trans-unit.target: **Table**: A table is a collection of entities.

trans-unit.source: Tables don't enforce
trans-unit.target: Tables don't enforce

trans-unit.source: a schema on entities, which means a single table can contain
trans-unit.target: a schema on entities, which means a single table can contain

trans-unit.source: entities that have different sets of properties.
trans-unit.target: entities that have different sets of properties.

trans-unit.source: The number of tables that a
trans-unit.target: The number of tables that a

trans-unit.source: storage account can contain is limited only by the
trans-unit.target: storage account can contain is limited only by the

trans-unit.source: storage account capacity limit.
trans-unit.target: storage account capacity limit.

trans-unit.source: **Entity**: An entity is a set of properties, similar to a database
trans-unit.target: **Entity**: An entity is a set of properties, similar to a database

trans-unit.source: row.
trans-unit.target: row.

trans-unit.source: An entity can be up to 1MB in size.
trans-unit.target: An entity can be up to 1MB in size.

trans-unit.source: **Properties**: A property is a name-value pair.
trans-unit.target: **Properties**: A property is a name-value pair.

trans-unit.source: Each entity can
trans-unit.target: Each entity can

trans-unit.source: include up to 252 properties to store data.
trans-unit.target: include up to 252 properties to store data.

trans-unit.source: Each entity also has 3
trans-unit.target: Each entity also has 3

trans-unit.source: system properties that specify a partition key, a row key, and a
trans-unit.target: system properties that specify a partition key, a row key, and a

trans-unit.source: timestamp.
trans-unit.target: timestamp.

trans-unit.source: Entities with the same partition key can be queried more
trans-unit.target: Entities with the same partition key can be queried more

trans-unit.source: quickly, and inserted/updated in atomic operations.
trans-unit.target: quickly, and inserted/updated in atomic operations.

trans-unit.source: An entity's row
trans-unit.target: An entity's row

trans-unit.source: key is its unique identifier within a partition.
trans-unit.target: key is its unique identifier within a partition.
